title.en: Written Translation from Estonian into English

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course focuses on the texts from different genres and topics ranging from academic to media texts and encompassing the fields of politics, economy, culture, medicine, etc. The students have to prepare a translation for each session as a home task. Students' translations will be discussed and bettered during the seminar sessions.
description.et: Kursusel käsitletakse tekste erinevatest žanridest (akadeemiline, meediatekst, jne.) ja ka erinevatest teemavaldkondadest (poliitika, majandus, kultuur, meditsiin). Üliõpilased tõlgivad iseseisva mitteauditoorse tööna igaks seminariks erineva teksti, mis siis koos seminaris läbi arutatakse.

objectives.en: The course is designed as a continuation course after the completion of Text Analysis I, II, III. The course teaches practical English through translation of different texts from Estonian into English, at the same time addressing the issues of students' language usage with the aim to better their English language skills.  The course offers the students an opportunity to practice different language registers and enlarge their vocabulary. The course is aimed for students majoring in English language and literature.
objectives.et: Kursus on mõeldud inglise filoloogidele jätkukursusena peale praktilise inglise keele kursuse Tekstianalüüs I,II,III läbimist. Kursus õpetab tekstide eesti keelest inglise keelde tõlkimise kaudu praktilist inglise keelt, tuues välja õppuri individuaalsed vead inglise keele kasutuses. Samuti võimaldab kursus üliõpilasel läbi proovida erinevaid keeleregistreid ja omandada erinevate valdkondade erialaspetsiifilist sõnavara. Kursus on mõeldud inglise keelt ja kirjandust peaainena õppijatele.

learning_outcomes.en: The course aims to better students' skills in practical English language. In addition to that the students will have a comparative overview of the problems of translation specific to the translation from Estonian into English. The course will provide the students with an overview of different types of texts, registers and special language. As the students are expected to translate approximately 13 texts during the course, they will acquire the basics of the practice of translation as well as editing.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursus täiendab üliõpilase praktilise inglise keele oskusi ja annab ülevaate eesti keelest inglise keelde tõlkimise problemaatikast, võrreldes mõlema keele väljendusvahendeid. Kursus annab ülevaate erinevatest tekstitüüpidest, registritest ja ka erialaspetsiifilisest sõnavarast. Kuna kursuse jooksul tõlgib iga üliõpilane vähemalt 13 teksti, saab üliõpilane ka algtasemel tõlke ja tõlketekstide editeerimise praktikat.

independent_work.et: Students have to prepare a written translation for each seminar if not stated otherwise. The students are allowed to correct their independent translations during the seminar. The students hand in their translation at the end of each seminar for grading. Plagiarism of any kind is not tolerated.

description.et:
1. Inglise keele korrektne kasutus
2. Tõlke vastavus originaaltekstile
3. Kodutööde õigeaegne esitamine
4. Osalemine seminarides 90-100 %
5. Ettekande esitamine
6. Kirjalik eksam

1. Inglise keele korrektne kasutus
2. Tõlke vastavus originaaltekstile
3. Kodutööde õigeaegne esitamine
4. Osalemine seminarides 90-100 %
5. Ettekande esitamine
6. Kirjalik eksam

grade_preconditions.et:
Attendance (if not inhibited by the general health situation) and active participation in seminars and text discussions. 
All translation tasks must be completed prior to the final examination. Failing to hand in a translation during the term makes the student ineligible for the final examination.
Assignments:
Students are expected to hand in assignments by the set deadline (each seminar if not told otherwise). Extensions are possible but prior agreement, if at all possible, is required.

grade_evaluation.et:
Final form of assessment is a 24-hour take-home examination.
(Completion of translation tasks (100%) and participation in the discussion of the translated texts will make you eligible for the examination.)

debt_elimination.et:
Due to the specificity of the course:
If a student fails to fulfill course requirements, he/she has to retake the course.

resources.mandatory_materials: Your own translation and the Estonian original should be at hand in the seminars.
resources.recommended_materials: A reputable monolingual dictionary. Web-based translational tools and corpora.

description.et:
Start 16.00 on 09.05.(exam text will be uploaded to Moodle)
Deadline 16.00 on 10.05. (you need to upload your exam translations in Moodle)

audience.et: eeldusained: Tekstianalüüs I, II, III, Inglise keele praktiline grammatika FLGR.01.042
